title: Declarative Learning Design Through Spatial Navigation: Science Concept Structuring Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: Learners train to convert scientific concepts into declarative knowledge through spatial exploration experiences. Project-based assessments measure real-world problem-solving abilities

learning_goals: Learners can represent scientific concepts in a three-dimensional structure using spatial mapping tools.
Learners can systematically organize complex scientific information by applying spatial navigation strategies.
Learners can analyze relationships between concepts through spatial representations of declarative knowledge.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
